data.title: George W. Redman - Myrtle Beach Attorney - Bellamy Law Firm
data.meta_description: The Bellamy Law Firm has been serving the Grand Strand since 1962. Meet our Myrtle Beach attorneys, including George W. Redman.
data.text:
George Redman is a Shareholder in the firmâ€™s trial & litigation department, where he represents clients in a wide range of business, commercial, real estate property, and general litigation matters. As a litigation attorney, George seeks to identify and obtain the best results possible, to avoid future litigation or claims, and to serve as a formidable advocate when necessary.

George was born in Rapid City, South Dakota and moved to the Myrtle Beach area in 1990. He attended Coastal Carolina University and earned a Bachelors of Science degree in Biology, as well as a Bachelors of Arts degree in Business Management from the Wall School of business in 2001. George graduated from the University of South Carolina School of Law in 2004 with honors as a member of the Order of the Wig and Robe. During law school he earned a position as a member of the Moot Court Board, and served as an Articles Editor for the American Bar Associations Real Property, Probate and Trust Journal. George received CALI Awards in Estate Planning and in English Legal History.

When he is not practicing law, George is involved in the Grand Strand community. He is a member of the Christ United Methodist Church, the Lakewood Elementary PTA, the Grand Strand Runners Club, past President and a current member of the Coastal Carolina Sertoma Club, and a former member on the Board of Directors for the Coastal Carolina University Alumni Association.

Born:

Rapid City, South Dakota

Education:

University of South Carolina, J.D. (2004, cum laude); Coastal Carolina University, B.S., Biology (1995), B.A., Business Management (2001)

Admitted:

South Carolina (2004); North Carolina (2011); United States District Court of South Carolina (2005); 4th Circuit Court of Appeals (2005); United States District Court, Eastern District of North Carolina (2014)
